derivation: a primitive root (probably rather the same as H2973 (יָאַל) through the idea of mental weakness);
outline:
1. to begin, make a beginning, show willingness, undertake to do, be pleased, be determined
    1. (Hiphil)
      1. to agree to, show willingness, acquiesce, accept an invitation, be willing
      2. to undertake
      3. to resolve, be pleased, be determined
kjv_def: assay, begin, be content, please, take upon, [idiom] willingly, would.
strongs_def: properly, to yield, especially assent; hence (pos.) to undertake as an act of volition
